page.title: 07WARRINGTON GUARDIAN
page.content: {The Warrington Guardian This was founded as a family newspaper by A.Mackie in 1853. There is now a main edition for Warrington with special editions for the districts - Stockton Heath,Lymm,and Penketh, with a Midweek edition as well. The front page carries stories of national issues as they affect this locality eg. acid rain. There are also local items - Walking Day, council matters and advertisements. Over half of the paper is given over to advertising, a lucrative source of finance for production costs. Modern technology, photography and investigative journalism combine to produce a newspaper which accurately reflects the society, gives information, acts as a watchdog and is a truly independent publication.
